item.description:
As always this event is rain or shine... 90% of the time when they say it's going to rain it doesn't and when it does it's a drizzle. So just plan on going. And you live in New England for gosh sakes! Invest in a gortex jacket, wool socks, and good footwear.

So we'll take a rain, snow or shine walk at Hingham's Worlds End then we'll try the Hingham Beer Works for Drinks and Appetizers. Last time we did Alma Nove - let's try something new.  I will post separate events for the walk and the restaurant just in case some can can only make it to one of the other. Please respond to both so I can make accurate reservations at the restaurant.

What makes World’s End a special place?
We think it’s the tree-lined carriage paths and sweeping views of the Boston skyline, only 15 miles away. The 251-acre coast-scape includes rocky shores, broad hillsides, and open fields bracketed by pockets of woodlands. The property is ideal for walking, picnicking, jogging, horseback riding, cross-country skiing, or simply enjoying nature and the outdoors.

The retreating glacier helped create the geology of Boston Harbor, including the islands and the four spoon-shaped hills (called drumlins) that comprise World’s End. This landscape also features saltwater marshes, meadows, woodlands, and granite ledges covered with red cedars and blueberry thickets.

I am a member of the Trustees of the Reservations and they have great properties. I suggest that if you like their properties please become a member.

...http://www.thetrustee

 

Hingham Beer Works - http://beerworks.net/home/index.html
item.how_to_find_us: Go to the back parking lot and look for the surly group hanging around a Black Toyota Pickup

group.name: Boston Metro Hike Bike & Social Club

item.name: World's End Hike Hingham - Then Hingham Beer Works
